children.subject: Can someone in the EECS department confirm this?

pretty sure this kid is trying to get us to drop our classes so he can get into 168

-1

well what should we do then? for 162, when there was very low enrollment cap, all the discussions where open. So all of us just chose one and put ourselves on the waitlist. Now that the enrollment cap is slowly being lifted, a lot of us(including me, i am position #27) are in discussions that are already full. This is a catch 22, can someone on the other side please fix it? I don't care when my discussion is. I just want to get into the class :/

off topic, but this new cal central system is terrible :(. I miss telebears, and i never thought i would say that

at the moment if you guys cant get the tech people to fix it in time, it seems to me the only solution is to manually go through the waitlist and when you come up to someone in a full discussion, enroll them in a random, open one. No prof even cares which discussion you are actually enrolled in, you can attend whichever you want, and half the people don't go at all
+1 I think it would be unfair if we can't get into a class due to not being able to switch sections with the new enrollment system.

Mostafa, if you're #27 on the lecture waitlist, you are probably near the top of the waitlist for your section. In your case, I don't think this situation would have been that different even if we were still with telebears. there aren't really any available sections to switch to. maybe 107 and 108 but you would be person #3 on the section waitlist, assuming everyone currently on the waitlist for those sections get in.

Besides two, all the sections are "open", the only thing stopping people from trickling in is the cap right now for 162 at 150 students. So when it gets lifted to 200, the people in discussion sections 103 & 104(i am personally in 104) high up in the waitlist will get skipped since they are completely full. However, the people behind us who have enrolled in the open discussion sections will be enrolled
Yes; that is deliberate, as it had been in Telebears.
but steven its not like telebears, since i can't change my section without dropping. I am just showing Lily that i wont be fine, no matter where i am no the waitlist

I get what you're saying and I understand the frustration. Indeed people who waitlisted for those "open" sections will get in before you do (as they would have in telebears.) At this point in time with the number of people waitlisted for the  open sections, there's nothing to really do but wait for people to drop. I suppose you could argue that if there was an switch sections button then you could have switched into an open section earlier, but since 162 filled up so quickly this semester,  I'm not really sure that would've help.  I'm sorry that it's stressful. 162 is an early drop class,  and there is usually a lot of attrition. But please do plan for a backup, just in case. And you can send feedback to sishelp@berkeley.edu.

Thanks for posting this, I've been meaning to post something similar. Your second point has always been true even with Telebears, 

  • You can't get into a class unless there's lecture space and space in your secondary section i.e. you're stuck on the waitlist

but at least Telebears has a switch sections option. 

In Cal Central, if you're waitlisted, the only way to switch secondary sections is by dropping and re-adding. 

Sadly, Cal Central also doesn't show you your waitlist position for your secondary section.

This is how waitlists are processed: look at person #1 on the waitlist, check discussion section selection, if space, enroll, else, look at person #2. etc. 

tl;dr: You could be number 1 on the lecture waitlist and never get into the class because your section is full.
I've only dropped from #15 to #11 on the CS170 waitlist after over a month? Should I be taking any action? Will I get in the course?

history.content:
Hey guys, so these are some of my thoughts on the new Calcentral system. I'm assuming the following:

  • You can't switch secondary sections unless you're enrolled in a class
  • You can't get into a class unless there's lecture space and space in your secondary section i.e. you're stuck on the waitlist

This means that almost everyone in sections that are full are dead in the water. Even if there's space in lecture, they're gonna keep being skipped over for enrollment until space opens up in their section. If you go by the 10% drop-rate rule of thumb, that means most sections are gonna admit around 3 people from the waitlist. Everyone else just isn't gonna get in the class. Realistically, this means there'll be people that are 1st on the waitlist that don't get into a class but people that are 150th that do.

It's a pretty ridiculous catch-22. You can't enroll unless there's space in your section, and you can't switch your section unless you're enrolled. You're forced to drop and re-add. I Phase I'd CS168 and was 30th on the waitlist before I realized this. I was stuck in a full section so I dropped and re-added the class. If I didn't make some horrible mistake with my analysis I'm probably gonna get into the class now because there's so many people stuck in full sections.
history.subject: Why it might be worth dropping and re-adding a class
